title: Dependent Censoring Regression Models
text: package DepCens uses dependent censoring regression models survival multivariate data. models based extensions frailty models, capable accommodating dependence failure censoring times, Weibull piecewise exponential marginal distributions.

title: The 'DepCens' package. — DepCens-package
text: Dependent censoring regression models survival multivariate data. models based extensions frailty models, capable accommodating dependence failure censoring times, Weibull piecewise exponential marginal distributions. Theoretical details regarding models implemented package can found Schneider et al. (2019) <doi: 10.1002/bimj.201800391>.

title: The 'DepCens' package. — DepCens-package
text: Schneider, S.; Demarqui, F. N.; Colosimo, E. .; Mayrink, V. D. (2020). approach model clustered survival data dependent censoring. Biometrical Journal, v.62, n.1, 157--174. Louis, T. . (1982). Finding observed information matrix using EM algorithm. Journal Royal Statistical Society, B44, 226–233.

title: Dependent Censoring model — dependent.censoring
text: dependent.censoring can used fit survival data dependent censoring, can also utilized take account informative censoring.

title: Dependent Censoring model — dependent.censoring
code: dependent.censoring(   formula,   data,   delta_t,   delta_c,   ident,   dist = c("weibull", "mep"),   Num_intervals = 10 )

title: Dependent Censoring model — dependent.censoring
text: formula object class "formula": used 'time ~ failure covariates | informative covariates'. data data frame, list environment containing variables. delta_t Indicator function event interest. delta_c Indicator function dependent censoring. ident Cluster variable. dist distribution used model adjustment, specifies marginal distribution times (must either weibull mep). Num_intervals Number intervals time grid (mep ).

title: Dependent Censoring model — dependent.censoring
text: dependent.censoring returns object class "dcensoring" containing results fitted models. object class "dcensoring" list containing least following components: param_est vector containing estimated parameters (dependency parameter, regression coefficients associated failure times, regression coefficients associated dependent censoring times, time distribution parameters (Weibull piecewise exponential)). stde vector containing estimated standard errors estimated parameters vector. crit vector containing information criteria, Akaike's information criterion (AIC), Baysian information criterion (BIC), Hannan–Quinn information criterion (HQ), calculated according Louis, T. . (1982). pvalue p-value estimated parameters vector. n number observations dataset. p number covariates associated failure times (event interest times). q number covariates associated dependent censoring times (informative censoring times competitive risk times). formula formula used function call. terms terms object used, containing covariates associated failure times dependent censoring times. labels1 labels covariates associated failure times. labels2 labels covariates associated dependent censoring times. risco_a_T vector containing cumulative baseline hazar failure times. risco_a_C vector containing cumulative baseline hazar dependent censoring times. bi matrix containing generated fragilities, one outputs function dependent.censoring, individuals rows Monte Carlo replicas columns. X_T matrix variables associated failure times. X_C matrix variables associated dependent censoring times. time vector observable times.

title: Dependent Censoring model — dependent.censoring
text: function estimates parameters Piecewise exponential model (dist = "mep") Weibull model (dist = "weibull") dependent censoring, considering frailty model estimate clusters variability parameter captures dependence failure dependent censoring times.

title: Dependent Censoring model — dependent.censoring
code: # \donttest{ library(DepCens) delta_t <- ifelse(KidneyMimic$cens==1,1,0) delta_c <- ifelse(KidneyMimic$cens==2,1,0) fit <- dependent.censoring(formula = time ~ x1 | x3, data=KidneyMimic, delta_t=delta_t,                           delta_c=delta_c, ident=KidneyMimic$ident, dist = "mep") summary_dc(fit) #>  #> MEP approach #>  #> Name	 Estimate	 Std. Error	 CI INF 	 CI SUP	 	 p-value	  #> Alpha	1.313835	0.4372906	-1.261282	3.888952	0.00266	 #> Sigma	0.3996922	0.1884796	0.000000	1.183089	 #>  #> Coefficients T: #>  #> Name	 Estimate	 Std. Error	 CI INF 	 CI SUP	 	 p-value	  #> 	0.04750626	0.01984829	0.00860361	0.08640891	0.01669	 #>  #> Coefficients C: #>  #> Name	 Estimate	 Std. Error	 CI INF 	 CI SUP	 	 p-value	  #> 	0.01885825	0.1734772	-0.321157	0.3588735	0.9134	 #>  #> ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- #>  #> Information criteria: #>  #> AIC	 BIC	  HQ	 #> 477.1289 552.9902 507.8288  #>  # }

title: KidneyMimic data set — KidneyMimic
text: simulated data frame 200 individuals, distributed 40 clinics (clusters) 5 individuals per clinic. Simulated dataset mimic kidney result study. simulated dataset hypothetically suggested following causes outcome: event interest: death due kidney failure; dependent censoring: patient received transplant; administrative censoring: outcomes.

title: KidneyMimic data set — KidneyMimic
text: data frame 200 rows 9 variables: ident: Variable indicates clinic (cluster) patient. time: time observed occurrence outcome. event: variable indicates occurrence event interest, event=1 event interest occurs. x1: covariate 1, generated Uniform Distribution. Can denote, example, exam result. x2: covariate 2, generated Binomial Distribution. Can denote, example, treatment x3: covariate 3, generated Normal Distribution. can denote, example, standardized age. cens: variable indicates outcome, cens=1 event interest occurred (death due kidney failure); cens=2  dependent censoring occurred (patient received transplant); cens=3 administrative censoring. delta_t: indicator function event interest. delta_c: indicator function dependent censoring.

title: Plot the survival function — plot_dc
text: graph helps visualize survival function.

title: Plot the survival function — plot_dc
text: object object class "dcensoring". scenario defines scenario graph (t: failure times, c: dependent censoring times, ).

title: Plot the survival function — plot_dc
text: survival function graph fitted model.

title: Plot the survival function — plot_dc
text: order smooth line presented graph, used 'lowess' function. , can result non-monotonous survival function.

title: Plot the survival function — plot_dc
code: # \donttest{ fit <- dependent.censoring(formula = time ~ x1 | x3, data=KidneyMimic, delta_t=KidneyMimic$delta_t,                           delta_c=KidneyMimic$delta_c, ident=KidneyMimic$ident, dist = "mep") plot_dc(fit, scenario = "both")   # }

title: Print the summary output — summary_dc
text: Print summary output

title: Print the summary output — summary_dc
text: object object class "dcensoring". ... arguments passed methods.

title: Print the summary output — summary_dc
text: summary fitted model.

title: Print the summary output — summary_dc
code: # \donttest{ fit <- dependent.censoring(formula = time ~ x1 | x3, data=KidneyMimic, delta_t=KidneyMimic$delta_t,                           delta_c=KidneyMimic$delta_c, ident=KidneyMimic$ident, dist = "mep") summary_dc(fit) #>  #> MEP approach #>  #> Name	 Estimate	 Std. Error	 CI INF 	 CI SUP	 	 p-value	  #> Alpha	1.309234	0.6147124	-1.256865	3.875332	0.03319	 #> Sigma	0.4108953	0.1982387	0.000000	1.216250	 #>  #> Coefficients T: #>  #> Name	 Estimate	 Std. Error	 CI INF 	 CI SUP	 	 p-value	  #> 	0.04856939	0.02017417	0.009028015	0.08811076	0.01606	 #>  #> Coefficients C: #>  #> Name	 Estimate	 Std. Error	 CI INF 	 CI SUP	 	 p-value	  #> 	0.02585313	0.1739763	-0.3151404	0.3668467	0.8819	 #>  #> ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- #>  #> Information criteria: #>  #> AIC	 BIC	  HQ	 #> 476.2146 552.0759 506.9145  #>  # }
